revised_title: Hoarding Behavior and Fitness Consequences in Eurasian Red Squirrels
tldr: The study found that Eurasian red squirrels that spent more time hoarding and recovering cached food had higher body mass and were more likely to survive and reproduce. Hoarding behavior allowed squirrels to preserve food resources for future periods of scarcity, leading to better survival and reproductive success.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Behavior
